page.title: 09AN EVENT IN WOODTON
page.content: After 60 years of silence the bells of Woodton church rang in all their glory for Morning Service on 8 Jan 84.In 4 years Â£10000 was raised from functions & grants;in the newly-floored tower were a new bell-frame,6 retuned bells with clappers,wheels & stays;in the redorated ringing-room ceiling insul- ation & new ropes were installed for the Dedication Service on 28 Jan 84. Much of the work was done by volun- teers.Since then the bells have rung for every service and many other occasions,sometimes with visiting ringers,achieving quarter peals & 4 peals of 5040 changes. Helped by experienced people,locals practise every week to ring call changes for services. Woodton can proudly claim a new variation,the "Woodton Slow Course".
